ToolSet Overview

Send comments on this topic.
A ToolSet is a DCL based abstraction of common build process functionality that is used by Datalight products. ToolSets make Datalight products portable across many different development environments. Depending on the type of SDK you have licensed from Datalight, you will have one or more ToolSets supplied in your kit.

Toolsets are also extensible. If you need or prefer to use a different tool chain, you can create a new ToolSet that will plug your own development tools into the Datalight common build process. See the section "Creating a New ToolSet" for details on how to create a ToolSet abstraction to a new tool chain.

The ToolSet abstraction is provided for your convenience. As a source-code based product distribution, customers are free to compile the code using any means they choose.

Overview

Datalight has ToolSet abstractions for the following development tools. Note that the ToolSet concept should not be confused with the actual development tools (compilers and linkers) used to build the project. Datalight does not supply those tools, except for a version of GNU Make used during the build process.

ADS12 - This ToolSet is used to build using ARM Developer's Suite v1.2.
DIABVX5X - This ToolSet is used to build using Wind River Diab tools for VxWorks 5.x.
DIABVX6X - This ToolSet is used to build using Wind River Diab tools for VxWorks 6.x.
GHS - This ToolSet is used to build using Green Hills tools.
GNUCS - This ToolSet is used to build using Code Sourcery GNU tools.
GNUVX5X - This ToolSet is used to build using Wind River GNU tools for VxWorks 5.x.
GNUVX6X - This ToolSet is used to build using Wind River GNU tools for VxWorks 6.x.
MARVELLSDT - This ToolSet is used to build using the Marvell Software Developer's Tool Suite.
MICROTEC - This ToolSet is used to build using the Microtec tools.
MSVS - This ToolSet is used to build using Microsoft Visual 6, as well as Visual studio 2003 and 2005.
MSWCE - This ToolSet is used to build using Microsoft Windows CE 4/5/6 command-line tools.
MSWCEPB - This ToolSet is used to build using Microsoft Windows CE 4.x Platform Builder.
RVDS - This ToolSet is used to build using the ARM RealView Developer's Suite.
TASKING - This ToolSet is used to build using the Altium Tasking tools.

The Host Build Environment

The host build environment is the system on which the development tools are installed. Datalight products are written in ANSI C and are compatible with a wide variety of development tools and host environments. Datalight builds and tests this product using Microsoft Windows XP based host build environment. Using older versions of Windows is not recommended.

The standard Datalight ToolSet abstraction is designed for the Windows hosted build process. Builds on Linux or GNU hosted builds are handled differently.
